alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:59AM EDT until May 03 at 9:37AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Grafton and Belknap Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...From this morning to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. At 60,000.0 cfs, East River Road starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Monday the flow was 23,952.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 65,590.0 cfs this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 34,570.0 cfs Wednesday morning. It will rise to 34,650.0 cfs early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
